title: Live VIPIR 6 Weather Forecast 6/2 PM
content: It's been a warm, humid afternoon with a few storms across the southern half of the CSRA.  We're expecting a muggy evening and storms slowly fade out.  Tomorrow will be very hot with a high in the mid 90s and plenty of humidity.  Expect the heat index to reach the triple digits.  That means you need to stay out of the heat as much as possible and drink plenty of water.  Tomorrow afternoon and evening could see a pop up thunderstorm or two, some of which could have strong to damaging winds.  Once we get into the work week, we'll finally see a long stretch of sunshine with low rain chances.  We'll also see the highs drop a degree or two to around 90, so it could be a great week to get outside and enjoy the outdoors as long as you stay cool.  Our next rain chance won't return until next weekend.
